page.title: 02OUR AREA (CONT)RURAL C'FORD
page.content: Cutting right across the area,from the northeast to the southwest is the New Chelmsford Bypass. This is in the process of being built,but it is destroying the country side and cutting through good farming land. Most of the roads are narrow and have very little traffic except for the A130 Chelmsford to Southend, which is a very busy road. There is a small commuter village at Howe Green,but there are no shops or schools, only one small chapel. Most of the houses are fairly new, being built in the last twenty years or so, and a few old houses, which were probably farm cottages. The other houses in our area are mainly the older individual types of property. Some have land attached and a few animals such as chickens and goats.
